title: I-485 DENIED! due to J1 requirement.
question: Today my I-485 was denied because I did not apply for a J1 two-year waiver.
answers:
Do not leave just like that before talking to a lawyer. We need more information. We have had at least one similar situation in our office and we successfully obtained both the waiver and the greencard. We need to know how you are petitioning for the I-485. Did you get a non objection letter. Talk to a good lawyer to help. Our law firm is in the Bay Area.

Good Luck

We need more information. How did you qualify to file for adjustment? If you have a final order of voluntary departure, then staying past the grant can ban you from coming back to the U.S. for quite some time.

It seems like an experienced immigration attorney should look into what happened with the J-1 waiver request. Perhaps, it is more complicated than you thought. There may be ways to periodically return to your country, so that you can eventually lawfully return as an immigrant in spite of the Section 212(e) two year residency requirement. Yet, you will have to prove that you have served the two years in your designated country of Citizenship.

The above is general information and does not create an attorney-client relationship.
